qc.notes: â‰¥8 poses including all core views present; daylight with slight warm cast; minor softness on a few frames but details remain visible.

skin_type.label: combination
skin_type.rationale: T-zone shows more visible pores and mild natural sheen while the outer cheeks and jaw appear more balanced.

skin_tone_fitzpatrick.label: IV
skin_tone_fitzpatrick.note: Estimated visually from smartphone photos in daylight; exact typing needs in-person assessment.

skin_age_range.rationale: Low wrinkle burden suggests youthfulness; under-eye shadowing and cheek texture modestly increase the estimate. Lighting and camera auto-exposure introduce some uncertainty.

analysis.overview_explanation: Your skin looks healthy with minimal lines. The main opportunities are reducing pore visibility and smoothing cheek texture, plus brightening the under-eye area. Redness and pigmentation are mild, and acne activity looks low.

pores.rationale_plain: Moderate pore prominence on the nose and medial cheeks with some spread. Forehead and chin show smaller, finer pores.
possible_causes: Natural oil production in the T-zone can make pores appear larger.
Heat, humidity, and pollution can mix with oil, highlighting pores in photos.
Past breakouts may leave pores looking more noticeable over time.

citations.title: AI grading of enlarged pores (Dermatol Ther, 2024)

wrinkles.rationale_plain: Fine, short lines on the forehead and around the eyes are faint at rest. No deep or continuous folds are visible.
possible_causes: Normal facial expressions can leave faint lines over time.
Temporary dehydration or squinting may make fine lines appear slightly more visible in photos.

pigmentation.rationale_plain: Mild, low-contrast mottling on cheeks and forehead; overall tone is even. Under-eye darkening is considered separately.
possible_causes: Intermittent sun exposure can create subtle mottling over time, especially on cheeks and forehead.
Past blemishes may leave faint marks that gradually fade.

redness.rationale_plain: Mild central facial redness, especially around the nose and medial cheeks. No diffuse or intense background erythema.
possible_causes: Heat, exercise, or shaving can cause temporary increases in redness that show up in photos.
Environmental stressors such as wind or pollution may contribute to localized redness.

texture.rationale_plain: Noticeable grain and uneven microrelief on medial cheeks and nose, with smoother outer areas. No clear flaking is seen.
possible_causes: Higher oil output in the T-zone can accentuate surface roughness.
Past breakouts and shaving-related micro-irritation may add to a grainy look.

acne.rationale_plain: Low current activity with a few small lesions on cheeks; older faint marks are present. No nodules or scarring clusters are seen.
possible_causes: Sweat, oil, and occlusion (e.g., straps, masks) can lead to occasional clogged pores.
Shaving habits and friction may contribute to minor bumps.

under_eye.rationale_plain: Clear infraorbital darkening with mild hollowing; right side slightly more pronounced than left. Spread remains mainly within the eyelid area.
possible_causes: Thin lower-lid skin and natural hollowing can create persistent shadows.
Sleep schedule, screen time, or nasal congestion may accentuate day-to-day darkness.

region_summaries.summary_plain: Smooth with fine pore pattern and faint horizontal lines only on close look. Tone is even and redness is low.
Calm skin with minimal lines at rest and even tone. No prominent redness or pigmentation.
Under-eye darkening is visible but not widely spread. Skin surface looks smooth.
Slightly deeper under-eye shadow than the left; otherwise smooth skin.
Moderate pore visibility and texture near the nose; outer cheek is smoother and more even.
Similar to the left cheek with slightly more visible pores and grain centrally.
Most pronounced pores with mild alar redness. No active breakouts are evident.
Even tone and texture with no distinct lines at rest.
Mild texture and small pores; overall even and calm.
Balanced tone/texture; pores are small and redness is low.
Matches the left jaw with smooth microrelief and low redness.

limitations: Smartphone daylight images with mild warm cast; no device-based colorimetry.
Slight softness on some frames may reduce small-feature certainty.
Only one dedicated under-eye close-up; shadows can vary with head tilt/light.
